cut and copy your question and then answer it! or pass, or roll again or as many times as you want!

74. Would you wear anything special for real life zombie fighting?

As hilariously over-the-top yet still effective steel plate-armor would be... Probably just some chainmail padded with leather. Hell, leather armor would probably work, or silk. It'd have to be armor though not clothing. Realistically, though, I wouldn't bother, as I would wipe them out with the hilariously large amount of bullets that would be available. That is if the police, military, or random citizens didn't kill them first. Zombies wouldn't do so well in real life... . Too easy to kill.

Colette

25. Tell us about a near--attack close call you have had, or seen someone else have?

You have lot of those when you are the town's gatekeeper. Like when you come back to close the gates and forget you were outside scavenging, only to return to town and close less than a minute before the attack. Or when you rush to your computer or borrow a phone, just to close a couple of minutes before the attack. But definitely, the most stressing close call is when your coa or meta friend is scavenging outside and nobody is around to rescue him/her and you can only count the seconds before the attack hoping a hero with hero rescue available pops in to help. I've seen people rescued at 22:59 leaving me just seconds to close the gates .

On november 26, 2013
Colette

31. Tell us one Die2nite story? About anything.

Um... Stories go on the Die2Write thread, and there's a new contest going on. I'll be posting a story for this round, so I will post it later. Now, if you want a short story about D2N...

Once upon a time there was a town in the middle of the desert. The town had 40 citizens and was attacked every night by zombies! The citizens attempted to build defenses, and every day some of them even wondered around the desert trying to find useful stuff, and some were crazy enough to stay in the desert during the night, as sleeping near abandoned buildings magically generated a blueprint for weird constructions! The citizens attempted to hold off the zombie hordes, but more zombies appeared every night. After a few days, all citizens were eaten. The end.

Blaire

52. What is one tip you would tell a new player?

Avoid emotional entanglement. Don't get too wrapped up in emotions except when establishing a reputation. This allow you to work with the now, rather than getting trapped in could ofs and would ofs. Remember, people should be shunned for shunworthy actions, but don't lose your head over it. Avoid retaliating when it will not benefit you.

81. Do you have a favorite zombie movie?

Nah, they're all pretty much the same. There's always a small group of survivors that try to escape from the zombies and 90% of them will die in a tragic and/or stupid way (like sacrificing themselves, being bitten by a zombie and eventually transforming, killed by a gang, etc.) In the end only the protagonists (usually a couple) survive or get killed as well.

33. In your real life do you prepare for the apocalypse, stash stuff away? Preppers style!

Nope. I don't believe that zombies will suddenly pop out from out of nowhere, and if something apocalyptic happens (zombies or not), chances of surviving the first event are quite low anyway. Why bother?

56. Do you like going into the ruins?

Nope. You need too much patience and luck, especially if you are a Resident. Last time I tried I almost got myself killed .

93. What is your favorite hero class?

I won't even try to rhyme, but I'll list all hero classes from the one I like the most to the one I dislike the most.

Shaman. Finding and using souls is fun. And there's something in the RPing part that I like. Something like "the town's shaman or shawoman is magical, mystical and a bit crazy".
Tamer. The labradoodle is very useful, it's always amusing to see which is your dog's name, and it's kind of cute to have a dog following you around.
Survivalist. Very useful skills, even if being a crazy hermit doesn't sound like fun.
Technician. Interesting skills, but too specific. I usually stay away from ruins anyway.
Scout. I really don't see anything too useful or fun about this one. Seems lackluster to me.
Guardian. I've always thought that those shields are silly.

jkudlick

JoanneJkudlick... umm is that crime scene tape behind the dog....
What has been going on in your backyard!It's generic "CAUTION" tape, not crime scene tape. The HOA had to regrade the dog park in 2012 because whenever it rained, a huge ~150 square foot puddle formed and took days to dry out. The tape was there in an attempt to keep the dogs from tearing up the new grass.

The tape on the right side is next to the water fountain. The water fountain was moved to make room for the community garden behind it, and it took over a year to regrade and reseed that area.

89. Suggest a new contest or eventI know it's been done before, but how about another iteration of the Amazing Race? Teams of two must visit specific points on the map then return to town. Here's the differences:
The points to visit are only posted on the Town Forums at 2200 the day before you are to visit them.
No one can go out until after the attack on Day 2.
The team must travel together. One must post a note from the town gates when they depart, then again when they reach the point to be reached, and again from inside the town.
The 2 teams with the slowest elapsed times each day will be eliminated from the competition and are relegated to normal townie duties. NB: When there are four teams remaining, only one team is eliminated each day.
A system of time penalties and rewards will be established. For example: killing zeds could reward a team with reducing elapsed time by 30 seconds for each zed killed - screenshots must be provided to prove your team killed the zeds.

52. What is one tip you would tell a new player?

Find and use the forums!

A game that depends on communication cannot be enjoyed to its maximum capacity without the ability to communicate.

Aside from that theres a whole host of informative players just aching to share their knowledge (tip of the hat to kiwi et al) a mere click (or two) away.

And when youre between towns you can ALWAYS count on the weird and wonderful posts from Saucy or The Doughnut. And you dont even have to read Workshops posts if you dont want to because his avatar is so easy to recognise and skip

69. If you could erase or do away with one thing in the game what would you eliminate?
Not strictly in-game, but I would erase the coalition cap of 5 members. I think it would simplify a lot of things which are unnecessarily cumbersome, as well as having a long-term positive impact on the game, by making easier the process of creating new metas, which I believe would have the effect of a lot more people sticking to the game. (it's my impression that what makes a lot people stick to the game is the stimulating meta environment and friendships made within)
